message:
as experienced software engineers what are the most critical courses of this curriculum: https://github.com/open-source-society/computer-science 
by most critical i mean minimum courses that MUST be studied and practiced before graduation to be a skilled programmer .
story: ‎مصطفى يحيي‎ shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: open-source-society/computer-science
caption: github.com
description: computer-science - :mortar_board: Path to a free self-taught education in Computer Science!

data.message: and if you tried any, do you recommend a better course/material ?

if you are more directed into the scientific way 

https://www.dropbox.com/home?preview=Scientist-Factory-New-Plan-80-Complete.zip

also this is a list of the courses i made for myself to study , they aren't sorted :D . if you want we can study together 

Coursera - Learn to Program: The Fundamentals
Databases
Math
Discrete mathematics
Data structures and algorithms
Design in Computing
software engineering
Software building & testing & debugging
Visualization ( represent in the data in an analytical way )
Artificial intelligence
Machine learning
parallel programming 
functional programming
Networking
compilers
OS
Parallel Programming
User experience design
UX Design
Security


crash course on python
crash course on Git/ version control 
Crash course on mobile development (ios or android)
Crash course on web dev.
Crash Course on Design Thinking 
Crash course on big data
Crash course on data mining

math & problem solving on the go

https://www.udacity.com/course/cs259 software debugging
Coursera - Introduction to Logic, Coursera - Linear and Discrete Optimization, Coursera - Probabilistic Graphical Models, Coursera - Game Theory
MIT Mathematics for Computer Science,
MIT Introduction to Algorithms, Coursera Introduction to Algorithms Part 1 & Part 2, List of Algorithms, List of Data Structures, Book: The Algorithm Design Manual

http://dschool.stanford.edu/dgift/


https://www.quora.com/What-online-courses-should-can-a-non-CS-student-take-in-order-to-become-relatively-proficient-in-the-field-of-Computer-Science
thank you because you cared ,but the OSS curriculum is already GREAT !! and i'm only asking for the most critical courses that is a must to do before graduation please check it out .
I did searched for an answer for this question a lot and i ended up with OSS too its organized and well sorted there is a lot of people  worked on it to be like that
